commitResults.messageBody:
Changes were made to files in main after running the code with
checkstyle for any mistakes in coding style and standards.

Mainly changes where made to import ordering, placement of static
variables, indentations and javadoc.

This make sure that the code is align with coding standards and style
rules when using Java.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Java assertions for internal assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Having assertions checks the assumptions on the program's state and
logic to detect bugs early.

Assertion checks are added to Charmie.java, Parser.java and
Storage.java, files that have important logic that needs to be right all
the the time for the chatbot Charmie to run properly.

Assertions are used to verify internal assumptions such as:
- Parser always returns a Command
- Storage.load() never returns null
- TaskList and UI are initialized

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to improve quality and readability
commitResults.messageBody:
Code quality is important when it comes to readability for others and
ensuring no unsafe coding practices are found. This makes the code
easier for others to understand your code.

Areas changes were checked and improved on:
-use of deep nesting
-use of magic number
-logical code structure
-weak SLAP
-use of default branch
-avoiding empty catch block
Add Java assertions for internal assumptions
Refactor code to improve quality and readability

commitResults.messageTitle: Add UpdateCommand and correspiding parser logic
commitResults.messageBody:
This is for the new feature, the ability to update a task without having
to delete it. Many files need to be modified, parser was modified first.
The update command will have the following structure update index /field
[newvalue]. A new class UpdateCommand was made to carry out the logic
behind the feature.

We added:
-new parse logic to process the user's input and return a Pair of the field to update and the
corresponding new value along (based on the command line structure)
-parser will now recognise when the user's command is update
-UpdateCommand will be passing the index, field to update and new value
into the run() method to call the required methods in task and tasklist
(to be implemented)

These will ensure the user input is properly received and processed for
easy editing of all possible fields under all 3 task types.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more logic to run a Update command
commitResults.messageBody:
Modified TaskList.java to ensure the smooth running of the update
feature and Ui.java can print out the message required.

I added a new chatbot response to show the user the before and after of
the task update. I also has logic to ensure the old task is completely
replaced by the new task after update. Exceptiion are thrown when needed
to catch errors.

This is needed as it has derieved the basic logic needed for update
command so I can edit the abstract class Task and the children classes
along it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Task and its child classes for Update feat.
commitResults.messageBody:
These modification to Task and its child classes, ToDo, Deadline and
Event ensures each task called in edited/ updated accordingly based on
the field specified, based on the type of field each task possess,
under a new method, update(String field, String newValue).

For ToDo, there is only name field to edit. For Deadline, switch between
2 cases of either name or the deadline (indicated using by). Event is
switched between 3 cases, name, from and end. All 3 event type will
return a new Task with the new details.

This makes it easier when it comes to TaskList updating the list of
tasks with the new task that has been updated.

Merge Branch-A-extension to master 

This pull request is to merge branch used for extension feature, to update tasks, into master.

Changes:
- Added update command parsing in parser and logic to process user input
- Implemented UpdateCommand execution logic
- Added new method to print Chatbot response in class Ui
- Added new methods in Task and its children class to contain the logic for changing the details in the task

commitResults.messageTitle: Add AI.md to record Ai assistance
commitResults.messageBody:
AI such as Copilot and ChatGPT were used in assisting the creation of
chatbot Charmie to enhance my code.

AI was used for purposes such as:
-improve the quality of the current code
-tweak an existing feature to make it more useful to the user

This merge is necessary to add the changes made in branch-A-AiAssisted
into the master branch.

Changes made in branch-A-AiAssisted:
-Added new file called AI.md
-Documented some usage of AI in enhancing the code

Updated and cleaned the files under test according to recent updates on
the chatbot. This is to ensure that my test files are always in line
with the newest changes made.

Changes made to test files
-Removed certain test files, eg those under Task class and its children
-Updated ParserTest, StorageTest and TaskListTest
-Ensure at least two methods unit tested well using JUnit

These changes were made as some files do not necessarily need testing as
compared to others with more complicated logic to run the chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Parser: improve input parsing and validation
commitResults.messageBody:
Parser accepts malformed input for index-based and update commands.
Invalid input is processed until parsing fails, resulting in unclear or
misleading error messages. Field and value extraction for update command
also fails due to insufficient validation and incorrect splitting logic.

This makes the update command unreliable because valid command formats
may still be rejected as invalid input.

Let's
* refine index input handling to correctly process mixed input formats
* strengthen validation of update command field and value extraction

Stricter validation ensures commands fail early with clear error
messages. This improves user experience and keeps command behaviour
consistent across different input formats.

Branch A extension introduces improvements to parser input validation
and command error handling.

These changes need to be merged so that the main branch reflects the
latest parser behaviour and command reliability improvements.

Let's
* merge branch-A-Extension into master to integrate the completed
extension work.

Merging now prevents divergence between branches and ensures future
development builds on the updated parser implementation.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Add window title to GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
GUI does not display the product name in the window title bar.

This makes screenshots less identifiable and reduces overall product
polish.

Let's display "Charmie" in the window title bar.

Showing the product name improves screenshot clarity and makes the
application appear more professional.

commitResults.messageTitle: JUnit test: add  more comprehensive test files
commitResults.messageBody:
Added tests to improve coverage and validate key functionality. This
ensures errors are identified early on for easier debugging.

Let's add these test cases,
* ToDoTest.java – 14 tests for basic task creation and updates
* DeadlineTest.java – 23 tests for date parsing and task updates
* EventTest.java – 24 tests for multi-date events
* CommandTest.java – tests for command execution and edge cases
* ParserTest.java – expanded with 60+ tests for input parsing

These tests cover happy paths, edge cases, and error handling,
ensuring that Charmie behaves correctly and consistently.

Certain tests in ParserTest was unable to past due to incorrect test
inputs and logic in Parser. This shows flaws in Parser that need to be
addressed.

Let's modify Parser.java to handle edge cases in user input:
* Reject negative and non-numeric indices for update commands
* Trim input to prevent whitespace-only descriptions
* Correct field/value extraction for update commands

Let's modify ParserTest.java to cover these cases and ensure:
* Negative, zero, and invalid indices throw CharmieException
* Empty or whitespace-only task descriptions throw exceptions
* Input parsing works correctly for extra spaces and malformed commands

These changes improve input robustness, prevent invalid commands,
and ensure all related tests pass.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add CSS styling for chat bubbles in GUI
